name: Creating the Future: The History of Innovation
base_name: Creating the Future: The History of Innovation
long_desc: CMU prides itself on being a hotbed of innovation, but how are new ideas developed By exploring the history of innovation, this course will prepare students to develop new ideas of their own and to better understand what inspires and constrains innovation.

custom_fields.goals: By the end of the course, students will be able to 1 Identify key drivers of innovation and the constraints that have impeded innovation 2 Analyze competing arguments about the origins of key advances in science, technology, business, culture, and society 3 Assess different models of innovation and identify the strengths and weaknesses of those models 4 Defend original frameworks for how to increase innovation moving forward 5 Communicate those frameworks via oral presentations and the written wordUnderstand, from a critical perspective, the choices and actions of key individuals, the results and legacy of historic events, and how to write argumentdriven essays with evidence, logic, and creativity
custom_fields.key_topics: innovation; social innovation; entrepreneurship; social entrepreneurship
custom_fields.learning_resources: articles, excerpts from books, videos/movies, websites
